title: Symbolic links in binarycache bundles need to be relocated.

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
<!-- Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran `spack find` to list all the installed packages and ..." -->

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install cudnn
$ spack binarycache create -d <location> cudnn
<look at the incorrect links in the binary package>
```

### Error Message

I untarred the .spack file, then ran `tar tzvf *.tar.gz`.  I see this:
```
lrwxrwxrwx blake14/blake14     0 2020-10-15 14:33 cudnn-7.6.5.32-10.1-linux-ppc64le-vbhtwfg4trkseuelk4e6626u6fjajapp/include -> /usr/WS2/blake14/deploy.spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-power9le/gcc-8.3.1/cudnn-7.6.5.32-10.1-linux-ppc64le-vbhtwfg4trkseuelk4e6626u6fjajapp/targets/ppc64le-linux/include
lrwxrwxrwx blake14/blake14     0 2020-10-15 14:33 cudnn-7.6.5.32-10.1-linux-ppc64le-vbhtwfg4trkseuelk4e6626u6fjajapp/lib -> /usr/WS2/blake14/deploy.spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-power9le/gcc-8.3.1/cudnn-7.6.5.32-10.1-linux-ppc64le-vbhtwfg4trkseuelk4e6626u6fjajapp/targets/ppc64le-linux/lib
```

These symbolic links point to my personal spack install directory.  They need to be relocated just like the rest of the paths.


### Information on your system

* **Spack:** 0.15.4-1651-978d8ad
* **Python:** 3.7.2
* **Platform:** linux-rhel7-haswell
